column4: Having  problems opening rar files. Could someone please help? Newbie.
have you installed unrar? its part of ubuntu-restricted-extras
yes but I cant find it in menu
its a cli util
newbie I dont understand
so you might have to open the terminal, you can also try using file-roller
fileroller in synaptic
just do a search?
so I install the package file-roller and it will extract my rar files?
its a gui and it might be able to use unrar to extract. if it doesn't offer that option then you would have to open a terminal and use unrar on the cli
apparently file-roller comes install as default in ubuntu 10.10 but, its not in menu and a file search results in nothing
it would be listed as archive manager in the menu or archive something
I've read everything in the menu and there is nothing that even remotely resembles an Archiver

well you could do it from the terminal. identify what folder the .rar is in open a terminal and then type "cd /path/to/the/rar/file" but without the "filename.rar" at the end (just the directory). then type unrar e filename.rar and it will extract into that directory
ok
I have 700 rar files to extract.
ok. for f in *.rar do; unrar e $f; done;
; before do not after sorry
for f in *.rar; do unrar e $f; done will extract all rar files to the current directory (and flatten any directories inside those rar files x instead of e will not flatten the subdirectories)
and if any of those files have spaces in their names then you need to use "$f"
ls *.rar does it list the rar files you want to extract
ty for your help its working
